required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Fetal MPI in Abnormal Cardiotocography Cases in 3rd Trimester of Pregnancy and Fetal Outcome.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Fetal Myocardial Performance Index in Abnormal Cardiotocography Cases in 3rd Trimester of Pregnancy and Fetal Outcome

brief_summary.textblock: The study will focus in evaluation of fetal cardiac function by using myocardial performance index in fetuses with abnormal cardiotocography in 3rd trimester.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will focus in evaluation of fetal cardiac function by using myocardial performance index in fetuses with abnormal cardiotocography in 3rd trimester.
Study Hypothesis:
In women with non reassuring fetal cardiotocography, myocardial performance index may predict fetal distress accurately.
Study Question:
In pregnant women in the third trimester with abnormal cardiotocography, Does myocardial performance index predict fetal distress accurately?
Study Objectives:
This study aims to assess the accuracy of myocardial performance index in predicting fetal distress in pregnant women with non reassuring cardiotocography in third trimester.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the Fetal Myocardial Performance Index.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3rd Trimester CTG, immediately followed by Fetal Echocardiography at the same set
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the Fetal Myocardial Performance Index in Abnormal Cardiotocography Cases in 3rd Trimester of Pregnancy and Fetal Outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately postnatal (first five minutes after delivery)
secondary_outcome.description: APGAR score at the first and fifth minute

arm_group.description: This group includes pregnancies that showed abnormalities in CTG.
This group includes pregnancies that showed no abnormalities in CTG.

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women in 3rd trimester attending for CTG

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Women between 30-40 weeks gestational age.
2. Women pregnant in singleton fetus.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Multiple pregnancies.
2. Fetal congenital malformation.

overall_official.last_name: Mohamed H Nasr El din, MD
